text:
You are entitled to that opinion but you shouldn't state things like "no (relevant) correlation" without qualifiers.
My qualifiers were "I am" (my impression is) and "quiet sure" (not fully convinced and am willing to drop that when presented with evidence). "All absolutes are wrong" ;-)
Just a question out of curiosity do you think that season dependence of the flu is a climate related effect?

Some (possibly) relevant info -

1. mechanisms behind the seasonality of flu are not well understood. Lots of plausible hypotheses, but nothing definitive
2. COVID has been really bad in places that don't tend to get cold and dry the way that Europe/US do, and in ways to that don't track directly with seasons (eg southern hemisphere, cf Brazil)
